title: ScottishPower hails milestone as 1MW battery exports for the first time
lead: ScottishPower Renewables’ 1MW Cornwall battery energy storage system has exported electricity for the first time, marking a significant milestone for the company's pipeline.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Clean energy professionals once again recognised in New Year’s Honours list
lead: ​Once again, energy professionals and companies have been recognised in the new New Year’s Honours list.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Why the ‘energy-mobility nexus’ holds the keys to the clean, green cities of the future
lead: As EV uptake grows, the potential strain on the electricity grid is becoming clearer, but there are clear ways to address this ‘energy-mobility nexus’ challenge writes Hitachi ABB’s Andre Burdet.
author: Andre Burdet

title: No coal in the nation’s stocking: Britain sees first coal-free Christmas Day
lead: Britain had its first coal-free Christmas, while wind set a new generation record on Boxing Day to round off a record-breaking year for green energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Macquarie confirms meeting £3bn investment criteria of Green Investment Bank acquisition
lead: ​In a letter to energy minister Kwasi Kwarteng, Macquarie has confirmed that it has surpassed its £3 billion investment target.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part thirteen
lead: Independent energy consultant Stephen Cirell​ offers his suggestions for the role of local authorities in the energy transition in 2021, for the thirteenth installment of Current± Predicts.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part twelve
lead: Part twelve of the Current± Predicts series sees a number of experts from Smarter Grid Solutions offer their take on the energy transition in 2021.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part eleven
lead: In part eleven of our Current± Predicts series, Pale Blue Dot Energy's Alan James talks hydrogen, Millhouse Power's Dave Openshaw reviews taking a whole systems approach and Pegasystems's Jo Allen discusses how utilities can stay ahead of the curve in 2021.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part ten
lead: In the tenth edition of Current± Predicts, Bulb's Kit Fitton and Geotab's David Savage give their predictions for 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part nine
lead: In this edition of the Current Predicts series, NewMotion's Melanie Lane outlines her expectations for EVs and Social Energy's Steve Day makes his flexibility predictions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part eight
lead: In part eight of Current± Predicts, Good Energy's ​Kit Dixon foretells policy changes while Northern Powergrid's Iain Miller bets on community energy.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part seven
lead: In the seventh installment of Current± Predicts, Pivot Power's Matt Allen and Aceleron's Carlton Cummins discuss how the envision the energy transition in 2021.
author: Current± Staff

title: Chameleon to ‘accelerate product development roadmap’ following management buy-out
lead: ​Energy tech firm Chameleon Technology has revealed that a management buy-out of the business has taken place.
author: Alice Grundy

title: The known unknowns of energy contracts: What all business leaders should be aware of
lead: Haven Power's Mark Anderson take a look at the changes the energy sector can expect in terms of third-party costs, Renewable Obligation mutualisation, and more.
author: Mark Anderson

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part six
lead: In part six of Current± Predicts, Pod Point's ​James McKemey and Osprey's Ian Johnston speculate of how the EV charging sector will develop in 2021.
author: Current± Staff

title: SPEN invests £2.3m in 3D mapping technology to improve network resilience
lead: ​SP Energy Networks (SPEN) has made a £2.3 million investment into technology that creates 3D maps of electricity maps.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part five
lead: For the fifth installment of Current± Predicts, Green Energy UK's managing director Doug Steward takes a look back at the year that's been, and adds his two cents about what's to come.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current​±​ Chats: Kiwi Power's Thomas Jennings on the evolution of flexibility in 2020
lead: Kiwi Power's head of optimisation, Thomas Jennings, spoke to ​Current​±​ about what the most important flexibility developments have been this year and what 2021 may shape up to look like.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus Energy valuation grows to $2bn as it expands into Asia
lead: ​Octopus Energy has hit a $2 billion (£1.5 billion) valuation as it announces an expansion into Asia thanks to a partnership with Tokyo Gas.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: £120m sale of gas exploration interests to support SSE’s renewables and networks businesses
lead: ​SSE is to continue to focus on renewables and networks as it sells all of its interests in its portfolio of gas exploration and production assets.
author: Alice Grundy
